leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 生信-变异检测与基因分型生态
leaf_cluster.tool_form: CLI + 评测套件 + 数据集

tools.name: neural-admixture
tools.one_line_profile: Rapid population clustering tool using autoencoders
tools.detailed_description: A library for rapid population clustering and admixture analysis using autoencoders, providing a faster alternative to traditional methods like ADMIXTURE.

tools.name: plinkr
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for PLINK
tools.detailed_description: A package that allows running PLINK commands and handling PLINK files directly from within the R environment.

tools.name: angsd-wrapper
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper utilities for ANGSD analysis
tools.detailed_description: A set of wrapper utilities to facilitate the analysis of next-generation sequencing data using ANGSD, simplifying command-line interactions.

tools.name: KGD
tools.one_line_profile: Kinship estimation for GBS data
tools.detailed_description: A tool for estimating kinship (genetic relatedness) specifically designed for Genotyping-by-Sequencing (GBS) data with depth adjustment.

tools.name: snipar
tools.one_line_profile: Family-based GWAS and imputation tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for imputation of parental genotypes, inference of sibling IBD segments, family-based GWAS, and polygenic score analyses.

tools.name: AlphaImpute2
tools.one_line_profile: Pedigree and population-based genotype imputation
tools.detailed_description: Software for genotype imputation that leverages both pedigree information and population haplotypes to impute missing genotypes.

tools.name: AlphaPlantImpute2
tools.one_line_profile: Genotype imputation for plant populations
tools.detailed_description: A specialized version of AlphaImpute designed for genotype imputation in plant breeding populations.

tools.name: DPGT
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed population genetics analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A distributed tool for population genetics analysis enabling joint calling on millions of whole genome sequencing samples.

tools.name: PopGen.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Population Genetics library in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Julia package for population genetics analysis, providing functions for data manipulation and statistical inference.

tools.name: bpp-popgen
tools.one_line_profile: Bio++ Population Genetics Library
tools.detailed_description: The population genetics component of the Bio++ library, offering classes and functions for analyzing genetic diversity and structure.

tools.name: simuPOP
tools.one_line_profile: Forward-time population genetics simulation environment
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose forward-time simulation environment for population genetics, allowing modeling of complex evolutionary scenarios.

tools.name: bayesian-matrix-population-model
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian matrix population model
tools.detailed_description: A Bayesian approach to size-structured matrix population modeling to estimate rates of cell division, growth, and respiration.

tools.name: impute-pipe
tools.one_line_profile: SGE cluster genotype imputation pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A canonical pipeline for genotype imputation designed to run on SGE (Sun Grid Engine) clusters.

tools.name: SimRA
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation framework for evolutionary scenarios
tools.detailed_description: A framework for simulating generic and complex evolutionary scenarios of multiple populations with subdivision and admixture using random-graphs algorithms.

tools.name: AdmixTools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for admixture analysis
tools.detailed_description: A software package for inferring admixture and population history from genetic data, including f-statistics and admixture graphs.

tools.name: graphtyper
tools.one_line_profile: Population-scale genotyping using pangenome graphs
tools.detailed_description: A tool for population-scale genotyping that utilizes pangenome graphs to improve variant calling accuracy.

tools.name: MARBLE
tools.one_line_profile: Representation learning for non-linear dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A package for data-driven representation of non-linear dynamics over manifolds, applicable to neural systems and dynamical systems.

tools.name: strataG
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for population structure analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R toolkit for haploid sequence and multilocus genetic data summaries, and analyses of population structure.

tools.name: tidypopgen
tools.one_line_profile: Tidy grammar for population genetics in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing a tidy grammar for population genetics, facilitating the manipulation and analysis of large SNP datasets.

tools.name: RelateAnything
tools.one_line_profile: Visual mask identification model
tools.detailed_description: A model capable of taking an image as input and utilizing SAM (Segment Anything Model) to identify corresponding masks, applicable in computer vision tasks.

tools.name: VGpop
tools.one_line_profile: Population genetics analysis toolkit for Variation Graphs (VG)
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to perform population genetics analyses directly on Variation Graphs (pangenome graphs), enabling the study of genetic variation within a graph-based reference framework.

tools.name: haploMAGIC
tools.one_line_profile: Haplotype reconstruction and phasing tool for multiparental populations
tools.detailed_description: An R package for phasing, haplotype reconstruction, and crossover detection using SNP data, specifically optimized for multiparental populations in plant or animal breeding.

tools.name: MultLocMixMod
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-locus mixed-model approach for GWAS in structured populations
tools.detailed_description: An efficient multi-locus mixed-model implementation for Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS), designed to handle population structure and improve power in detecting associations.

tools.name: mlmm
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient multi-locus mixed-model for GWAS
tools.detailed_description: A computational tool implementing the Multi-Locus Mixed-Model (MLMM) method for Genome-Wide Association Studies, correcting for population structure and confounding factors.

tools.name: mtmm
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-trait mixed-model for GWAS of correlated traits
tools.detailed_description: A mixed-model approach for Genome-Wide Association Studies that analyzes multiple correlated traits simultaneously in structured populations to increase detection power.

tools.name: STEAM
tools.one_line_profile: Significance Threshold Estimation for Admixture Mapping
tools.detailed_description: An R package for estimating significance thresholds in admixture mapping studies, helping to correct for multiple testing in admixed populations.

tools.name: inPHAP
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualization tool for phased haplotypes
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based interactive viewer for phased haplotype data, allowing researchers to visualize and explore haplotype structures and phasing results.

tools.name: easyfinemap
tools.one_line_profile: User-friendly pipeline for GWAS fine-mapping
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based pipeline designed to simplify the process of fine-mapping causal variants in Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) loci.

tools.name: admix-kit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for analyzing genetics data from admixed populations
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit providing utilities for processing and analyzing genetic data specifically from admixed populations, including local ancestry inference handling.

tools.name: hapcorrect
tools.one_line_profile: Correction of haplotype phase-switching errors in long reads
tools.detailed_description: A tool for correcting phase-switching errors in haplotype assembly using long-read sequencing data, improving the quality of phased assemblies.

tools.name: ENIGMA Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for accessing and analyzing ENIGMA neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: An open-source repository for accessing ENIGMA statistical maps, visualizing cortical/subcortical surface data, and relating neuroimaging findings to brain organization.

tools.name: IsoMaTrix
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization and uncertainty quantification for matrix games in structured populations
tools.detailed_description: A framework to visualize the isoclines of matrix games and quantify uncertainty in structured populations, often used in mathematical oncology and evolutionary game theory.

tools.name: SLiM
tools.one_line_profile: Genetically explicit forward simulation framework for population genetics
tools.detailed_description: A powerful and flexible forward simulation software package for population genetics and evolutionary biology, featuring a built-in scripting language (Eidos) and a graphical modeling environment.

tools.name: ADMIXTURE
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for maximum likelihood estimation of individual ancestries
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for maximum likelihood estimation of individual ancestries from multilocus SNP genotype datasets, widely used for population structure analysis.

tools.name: ADMIXTURE.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia wrapper for the ADMIXTURE ancestry estimation program
tools.detailed_description: A Julia interface to the ADMIXTURE software, allowing users to run ancestry estimation analyses directly from the Julia programming environment.

tools.name: SnpArrays.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient compressed storage for SNP data in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing efficient, compressed storage and manipulation utilities for Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP) data, optimized for large-scale genetic analyses.

tools.name: VarianceComponentModels.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for fitting variance component models in genetics
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for fitting and testing variance component models (linear mixed models), commonly used in statistical genetics for heritability estimation and association testing.

tools.name: POSYDON
tools.one_line_profile: Binary-star population synthesis code with full stellar structure
tools.detailed_description: A next-generation population synthesis code for single and binary stars that incorporates full stellar structure and evolution modeling using MESA grids.

tools.name: ARG-Needle
tools.one_line_profile: Library for analyzing Ancestral Recombination Graphs (ARGs)
tools.detailed_description: A library for representing, manipulating, and analyzing Ancestral Recombination Graphs (ARGs), which describe the joint genealogy of sampled DNA sequences along the genome.

tools.name: IBDGem
tools.one_line_profile: IBD detection and genetic identification from low-coverage data
tools.detailed_description: A program designed for positive genetic identification and Identity-By-Descent (IBD) segment detection, specifically optimized for low-coverage sequencing data such as ancient DNA.

tools.name: FASconCAT-G
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for concatenating and editing sequence alignments
tools.detailed_description: A versatile tool for concatenating, editing, and formatting multiple nucleotide or amino acid sequence alignment files for phylogenetic and population genetic analyses.

tools.name: TreeKnit.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Inference of Ancestral Reassortment Graphs for segmented genomes
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package that infers Ancestral Reassortment Graphs (ARGs) for segmented genomes, such as human influenza viruses, by knitting together phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: BEDMatrix
tools.one_line_profile: Matrix-like wrapper for PLINK .bed files
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides a matrix-like wrapper around PLINK binary (.bed) genotype files, allowing for memory-efficient access and manipulation of large genetic datasets.

tools.name: quetzal-CoaTL
tools.one_line_profile: C++ toolbox for geospatial population genetics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A C++ template library for building spatially explicit, coalescent-based population genetics simulators, designed for modeling complex demographic and spatial scenarios.

tools.name: HaploNet
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network-based haplotype and population structure inference
tools.detailed_description: HaploNet is a deep learning framework designed for haplotype estimation and population structure inference, leveraging neural networks to model complex genetic relationships.

tools.name: hapla
tools.one_line_profile: Haplotype clustering tool for phased genotype data
tools.detailed_description: Hapla provides functionality for clustering haplotypes within phased genotype datasets, useful for analyzing local population structure.

tools.name: PyClone
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic model for inferring clonal population structure
tools.detailed_description: PyClone is a probabilistic model used to infer the clonal population structure of cancers from deep NGS sequencing data, analyzing single nucleotide variants (SNVs).

tools.name: PyClone-VI
tools.one_line_profile: Fast variational inference for cancer clonal population structure
tools.detailed_description: PyClone-VI is a faster implementation of the PyClone model using variational inference, designed to infer cancer clonal population structure from SNV data efficiently.

tools.name: PhasedDiploidGenomeAssemblyPipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for reference-free diploid genome assembly using read phasing
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline that combines de-novo assembly and read-phasing techniques to construct reference-free diploid genome assemblies.

tools.name: DosageConvertor
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for VCF dosage files from Minimac to other formats
tools.detailed_description: DosageConvertor is a C++ utility to convert dosage files in VCF format (generated by Minimac3/4) to formats compatible with MaCH or PLINK.

tools.name: Minimac3
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient genotype imputation algorithm
tools.detailed_description: Minimac3 is a low-memory, computationally efficient implementation of genotype imputation algorithms, designed to handle large reference panels without loss of accuracy.

tools.name: PhaseGen
tools.one_line_profile: Inference on coalescent distributions under demographic scenarios
tools.detailed_description: PhaseGen performs computation and inference on exact solutions of coalescent distributions under diverse demographic scenarios, aiding in population genetic modeling.

tools.name: alstructure
tools.one_line_profile: R package for estimating admixture models of population structure
tools.detailed_description: alstructure implements the ALStructure algorithm to estimate admixture models of genetic population structure from genotype data.

tools.name: AdmixturePlotter
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization script for ADMIXTURE results
tools.detailed_description: An R script designed to generate plots for ADMIXTURE runs across multiple K values, facilitating the interpretation of population structure analysis.

tools.name: genome_structure_analysis
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis code for population and single-cell Hi-C data
tools.detailed_description: Provides functions for calculating Void regions, A/B compartments, and spatial density enrichment in population and single-cell Hi-C data.

tools.name: Diablo G25
tools.one_line_profile: VCF to 23AndMe converter and admixture score calculator
tools.detailed_description: A tool for converting VCF files to 23AndMe format and calculating admixture scores, useful for personal genomics and ancestry analysis.

tools.name: vcfdist
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking tool for phased variant calls
tools.detailed_description: vcfdist is designed to accurately benchmark phased variant calls, evaluating the quality of phasing and variant detection.

tools.name: mapmixture
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial visualisation of admixture on projected maps
tools.detailed_description: An R package and web app for the spatial visualisation of admixture proportions on projected maps, aiding in the geographic interpretation of population genetics data.

tools.name: Tom-Jenkins/utility_scripts
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of scripts for population genetics analysis
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing various utility scripts specifically designed for performing population genetics analyses.

tools.name: Genotype_Imputation_Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for processing and imputing TOPMED/dbGaP datasets
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive pipeline for processing genotype data, including QC, ancestry analysis, phasing, and imputation, specifically tailored for TOPMED and dbGaP datasets.

tools.name: GENESIS
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical methods for analyzing genetic data with population structure
tools.detailed_description: GENESIS (GENetic EStimation and Inference in Structured samples) provides statistical methods for analyzing genetic data from samples with population structure and/or relatedness.

tools.name: UW-GAC Analysis Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis pipeline for TOPMed data
tools.detailed_description: The analysis pipeline used by the UW-GAC for processing and analyzing TOPMed sequencing data, covering various genomic analysis steps.

tools.name: visual-physiology-opsin-db
tools.one_line_profile: Database and ML models for opsin genotype-phenotype prediction
tools.detailed_description: A database containing opsin genotype-phenotype data along with machine-learning models trained to predict opsin phenotypes from genotype data.

tools.name: scIBD
tools.one_line_profile: Doublet detection tool for scCAS data
tools.detailed_description: scIBD is a tool designed for detecting doublets in single-cell combinatorial indexing ATAC-seq (scCAS) data.

tools.name: PhaseGrass
tools.one_line_profile: Reference-based phasing workflow for diploid assembly
tools.detailed_description: PhaseGrass is a workflow for generating chromosome-level haplotype-resolved diploid assemblies for highly heterozygous genomes using reference-based phasing.

tools.name: NGSadmix
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for inferring admixture proportions from NGS data
tools.detailed_description: NGSadmix infers admixture proportions directly from Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) data, accounting for genotype uncertainty.

tools.name: fastman
tools.one_line_profile: R package for fast visualization of GWAS results
tools.detailed_description: fastman is an R package designed for efficient generation of Q-Q and Manhattan plots directly from PLINK output files for GWAS visualization.

tools.name: pgs
tools.one_line_profile: Population of Genome Structures modeling tools
tools.detailed_description: A package containing tools for modeling populations of genome structures, likely for 3D genome analysis.

tools.name: arginfer
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for inferring Ancestral Recombination Graphs
tools.detailed_description: arginfer is a tool for inferring Ancestral Recombination Graphs (ARGs), which are central to understanding the evolutionary history of sequences.

tools.name: mrpast
tools.one_line_profile: Demographic inference from Ancestral Recombination Graphs
tools.detailed_description: mrpast performs demographic inference using Ancestral Recombination Graphs (ARGs) as input.

tools.name: eigensoft
tools.one_line_profile: Principal components analysis for population genetics
tools.detailed_description: EIGENSOFT provides tools for performing principal components analysis (PCA) on population genetics data to detect population structure.

tools.name: clustOpt
tools.one_line_profile: Optimization of RADseq clustering thresholds
tools.detailed_description: Scripts designed to optimize clustering thresholds for RADseq data analysis in the context of population genetics.

tools.name: GWASpy
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for GWAS QC, PCA, haplotype phasing, and genotype imputation
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based pipeline designed for Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) that automates quality control, Principal Component Analysis (PCA), haplotype phasing, and genotype imputation.

tools.name: ADMIXTURE (R implementation)
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerated EM implementation of the ADMIXTURE model for population structure
tools.detailed_description: A simple accelerated Expectation-Maximization (EM) implementation of the ADMIXTURE model in R, used for estimating individual ancestries from multilocus genotype data.

tools.name: Mandrake
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization of pathogen population structure using Stochastic Cluster Embedding
tools.detailed_description: A tool for fast visualisation of the population structure of pathogens, utilizing Stochastic Cluster Embedding to project high-dimensional genetic data.

tools.name: Loter
tools.one_line_profile: Local ancestry inference and haplotype phasing software
tools.detailed_description: A software package designed for local ancestry inference (LAI) and haplotype phasing, particularly useful in admixed populations.

tools.name: TESS3
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial population structure estimation using matrix factorization
tools.detailed_description: A program for estimating spatial population structure based on geographically constrained non-negative matrix factorization and population genetics models.

tools.name: BEAGLE Library
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance library for phylogenetic likelihood calculations
tools.detailed_description: A general purpose library for evaluating the likelihood of sequence evolution on trees, used as a computational backend for many phylogenetics and population genetics software.

tools.name: flopp
tools.one_line_profile: Single individual haplotype phasing for polyploid organisms
tools.detailed_description: A software package for single individual haplotype phasing of polyploid organisms using long read sequencing data.

tools.name: GATK (Legacy)
tools.one_line_profile: Genome Analysis Toolkit (Versions 1.0-3.7)
tools.detailed_description: The legacy repository for the Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK), containing tools for variant discovery and genotyping (versions 1.0 through 3.7).

tools.name: GATK
tools.one_line_profile: Genome Analysis Toolkit for variant discovery
tools.detailed_description: The official repository for GATK 4+, the industry-standard toolkit for variant discovery in high-throughput sequencing data, including germline and somatic variant calling.

tools.name: mobster
tools.one_line_profile: Model-based tumour subclonal deconvolution
tools.detailed_description: A tool for model-based tumour subclonal deconvolution using population genetics principles to infer evolutionary dynamics from sequencing data.

tools.name: TRACK
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for analyzing tandem repeats in reference genomes
tools.detailed_description: A Snakemake pipeline that generates TR catalogs, identifies homologous TRs, and performs population-level genotyping and population genetics analyses on PacBio HiFi data.

tools.name: PAMES
tools.one_line_profile: Tumor purity estimation using DNA methylation
tools.detailed_description: A tool to estimate the purity of tumor samples by exploiting DNA Methylation data, aiding in accurate variant interpretation.

tools.name: PLINK 2.0 (plink-ng)
tools.one_line_profile: Whole genome association analysis toolset
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive update to PLINK, designed for high-throughput whole genome association analysis, offering extreme computational efficiency for large-scale genotype data.

tools.name: DILS
tools.one_line_profile: Demographic Inferences with Linked Selection
tools.detailed_description: A tool for performing demographic inferences while accounting for linked selection, useful in population genetics studies.

tools.name: liftover_plink_beds
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for lifting over PLINK BED files
tools.detailed_description: A WDL-based workflow for converting UK Biobank genome-wide genotyping data (PLINK format) from one reference build to another (liftover).

tools.name: GenoTools
tools.one_line_profile: Suite for genotype data processing, QC, and ancestry estimation
tools.detailed_description: A robust suite for processing genotype data, offering genotype calling (.idat to PLINK), comprehensive sample/variant QC, and ancestry estimation. Ideal for computational biology and genetics research.

tools.name: genimpute
tools.one_line_profile: Portable genotype imputation pipeline
tools.detailed_description: Portable genotype imputation pipeline used by the eQTL Catalogue, implemented in Nextflow for reproducibility and scalability.

tools.name: ERStruct
tools.one_line_profile: Inferring population structure using eigenvalue ratios
tools.detailed_description: The Official Python Version for the method 'An Eigenvalue Ratio Approach to Inferring Population Structure from Whole Genome Sequencing Data'.

tools.name: scphaser
tools.one_line_profile: Haplotype phasing using single-cell RNA-seq data
tools.detailed_description: R package designed for haplotype phasing specifically using single-cell RNA-seq data, enabling allele-specific expression analysis.

tools.name: pegas
tools.one_line_profile: Population and Evolutionary Genetics Analysis System
tools.detailed_description: An R package for the analysis of population genetics data, including functions for haplotype networks, diversity indices, and population structure.

tools.name: netviewr
tools.one_line_profile: Population structure inference using mutual nearest neighbor graphs
tools.detailed_description: A tool for population structure inference and visualization using mutual nearest neighbor graphs, implemented in Rust.

tools.name: VCF-Simplify
tools.one_line_profile: Parser to simplify and build VCF files
tools.detailed_description: A python parser designed to simplify and reconstruct VCF (Variant Call Format) files for easier handling and processing.

tools.name: phase-extender
tools.one_line_profile: Extends ReadBack phased haplotypes
tools.detailed_description: A python program that uses ReadBack phased haplotypes in a population of samples and returns extended haplotype blocks.

tools.name: phase-stitcher
tools.one_line_profile: Stitches ReadBack phased haplotypes in F1 hybrids
tools.detailed_description: A python program designed to stitch ReadBack phased haplotypes specifically for F1 hybrid organisms.

tools.name: imputePipe
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient genotype imputation pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline to impute to 1000 genomes efficiently by distributing to SGE, handling alignment, haplotyping, imputing, and filtering.

tools.name: plinkbinr
tools.one_line_profile: R package providing PLINK binaries
tools.detailed_description: R package that distributes PLINK binaries for Windows, Mac, and Linux, facilitating the use of PLINK within R workflows.

tools.name: kpop
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for population structure analysis
tools.detailed_description: A python package designed for performing population structure analysis on genetic data.

tools.name: bed-reader
tools.one_line_profile: Fast reader/writer for PLINK Bed files
tools.detailed_description: A library for easy, fast, and efficient reading and writing of PLINK Bed files (binary genotype format).

tools.name: BioBricks
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation framework for parental and admixture offsprings
tools.detailed_description: A simple framework to simulate parental and admixture offsprings, allowing for benchmarking of inheritance block distinction.

tools.name: plink2R
tools.one_line_profile: Import PLINK data into R
tools.detailed_description: A tool to read PLINK BED/BIM/FAM files directly into R for downstream analysis.

tools.name: conStruct
tools.one_line_profile: Model continuous and discrete population genetic structure
tools.detailed_description: A method and tool for modeling continuous and discrete population genetic structure, providing an alternative to discrete-only models like STRUCTURE.

tools.name: Michigan Imputation Server
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based service for genotype imputation
tools.detailed_description: Source code for the Michigan Imputation Server, a web-based service that facilitates access to reference panels and improves genotype imputation productivity.

tools.name: imputationserver2
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable genotype imputation workflow
tools.detailed_description: The workflow engine for Imputation Server 2, designed to facilitate genotype imputation at scale using Nextflow.

tools.name: rpd-sg10k-grch38-gatk4-gvcf-freebayes-vcf
tools.one_line_profile: WGS analysis workflow for SG10K Health
tools.detailed_description: Main genome analytics workflow powering the production analysis of WGS samples for the Singapore NPM Program, integrating GATK4 and Freebayes.

tools.name: haphpipe
tools.one_line_profile: NGS viral assembly and population genetics pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for NGS viral assembly and population genetics, designed to handle viral diversity and haplotype reconstruction.

tools.name: chipimputation
tools.one_line_profile: Genotype Imputation Pipeline for H3Africa
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow-based genotype imputation pipeline developed for the H3Africa consortium.

tools.name: popgen
tools.one_line_profile: Population genetics analysis tools
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools and libraries for performing population genetics analyses.

tools.name: mvBIMBAM
tools.one_line_profile: Genetic association analysis of multiple related phenotypes
tools.detailed_description: BIMBAM extension for genetic association analysis of multiple related phenotypes, facilitating multi-variate analysis.

tools.name: GLOBETROTTER
tools.one_line_profile: Haplotype-based admixture inference and dating software
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for inferring admixture events and dating them using haplotype data, widely used in population genetics to understand historical gene flow.

tools.name: fastGLOBETROTTER
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerated haplotype-based admixture inference software
tools.detailed_description: An optimized version of the GLOBETROTTER software, designed to perform haplotype-based admixture inference and dating more efficiently.

tools.name: metacarpa
tools.one_line_profile: Meta-analysis of genetic association studies accounting for relatedness
tools.detailed_description: A tool for performing meta-analysis of genetic association studies while explicitly accounting for sample relatedness and population structure.

tools.name: gwas-assoc
tools.one_line_profile: IKMB GWAS Association Testing Pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for performing Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) association testing, developed by IKMB.

tools.name: imputeqc
tools.one_line_profile: R package to estimate the quality of imputation of genotypes
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to assess and estimate the quality of genotype imputation results, crucial for downstream genetic analysis.

tools.name: GeneticsGPT
tools.one_line_profile: LLM-based interface for querying Open Targets genetics database
tools.detailed_description: An application leveraging GPT-3.5 to translate natural language queries into GraphQL for exploring the Open Targets genetics database.

tools.name: ohana
tools.one_line_profile: Population structure and admixture analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A software suite for mixture classification, constraint optimization, outlier detection, population structure inference, admixture history, and selection detection.

tools.name: popart
tools.one_line_profile: General purpose population genetics software
tools.detailed_description: Software for population genetics analysis, likely focusing on haplotype networks and diversity statistics (inferred from context of common PopART tool).

tools.name: mycorrhiza-algorithm
tools.one_line_profile: Ancestry prediction using phylogenetic networks and Random Forests
tools.detailed_description: An algorithm combining phylogenetic networks and Random Forests to predict ancestry from multilocus genotype data.

tools.name: GCTA
tools.one_line_profile: Genome-wide Complex Trait Analysis software
tools.detailed_description: A widely used software tool for estimating the proportion of phenotypic variance explained by genome-wide SNPs (GREML), and other complex trait analyses including PCA and relatedness estimation.

tools.name: MMQTL
tools.one_line_profile: Meta-analysis package for detecting multiple QTL signals
tools.detailed_description: A statistical package applying meta-analysis to detect multiple QTL signals integrating signals among conditions, with control for population structure and relatedness.

tools.name: kWIP
tools.one_line_profile: De novo estimates of genetic relatedness from NGS data
tools.detailed_description: A tool for estimating genetic relatedness directly from next-generation sequencing data without requiring a reference genome (alignment-free/de novo).

tools.name: kp_dadi
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for optimizing dadi demographic inference
tools.detailed_description: A workflow wrapper for manually optimizing the Diffusion Approximations for Demographic Inference (dadi) tool for population genomics analyses.

tools.name: tskit_arg_visualizer
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualization for ancestral recombination graphs
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for interactively visualizing Ancestral Recombination Graphs (ARGs) generated by tskit-compatible software.

tools.name: diveRsity
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive population genetics analysis package
tools.detailed_description: An R package for calculating various diversity statistics and population differentiation measures (e.g., Fst, Gst) with bootstrapping capabilities.

tools.name: PLINK.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia module to handle PLINK BED files
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for reading and manipulating PLINK binary genotype files (BED/BIM/FAM), facilitating bioinformatics analysis in Julia.

tools.name: discoal
tools.one_line_profile: Coalescent simulation with recombination and selection
tools.detailed_description: A coalescent simulation program capable of simulating models with recombination, selective sweeps, and demographic changes including population splits and admixture.

tools.name: prism
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical phasing software for long read data
tools.detailed_description: A statistical tool for phasing genotypes using long-read sequencing data.

tools.name: MetaDome
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization of genetic variation in protein domain context
tools.detailed_description: A tool to visualize the position of mutations of interest in the context of general population-based genetic variation and homologous domain positions.

tools.name: NAToRA
tools.one_line_profile: Relatedness-pruning method for genetic analyses
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit to execute kinship control analyses, minimizing the loss of dataset size in genetic and omics analyses by optimizing relatedness pruning.

tools.name: pyplink
tools.one_line_profile: Python module to read binary Plink files
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for parsing and reading binary PLINK genotype files, enabling custom analysis pipelines in Python.

tools.name: dipcall
tools.one_line_profile: Reference-based variant calling pipeline for phased haplotype assemblies
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for generating a VCF file from a pair of phased haplotype assemblies, typically used for evaluating de novo assembly quality and calling variants in phased genomes.

tools.name: pandas-plink
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for reading PLINK genotype files into Pandas dataframes
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides an interface to read PLINK binary files (bed/bim/fam) directly into Pandas dataframes and Dask arrays, facilitating genomic data analysis in Python.

tools.name: Octopus
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian haplotype-based mutation calling tool
tools.detailed_description: A sophisticated variant caller that uses a Bayesian haplotype-based model to detect germline and somatic mutations, capable of handling complex variants and polyploid organisms.

tools.name: SMC++ (smcsmc)
tools.one_line_profile: Demographic inference from whole genomes using SMC++
tools.detailed_description: A tool for inferring population history and demography from whole-genome sequence data using the Sequentially Markovian Coalescent (SMC) model.

tools.name: witsGWAS
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for Human GWAS analysis compatible with Affymetrix and Illumina data
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics pipeline designed to facilitate Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) by handling data from major genotyping platforms like Affymetrix and Illumina.

tools.name: admixture_graph
tools.one_line_profile: R module for analysing admixture graphs
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides tools for building, fitting, and visualizing admixture graphs to infer population history and relationships.

tools.name: admixr
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for ADMIXTOOLS
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides a convenient interface for running ADMIXTOOLS analyses (D-statistics, f3/f4 statistics) entirely within R.

tools.name: ArgWeaver
tools.one_line_profile: Sampling and manipulating genome-wide ancestral recombination graphs
tools.detailed_description: A tool for sampling and manipulating Ancestral Recombination Graphs (ARGs) to infer population history, recombination rates, and coalescence times from genome-wide data.

tools.name: Meteor
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for quantitative metagenomics profiling and strain-level inference
tools.detailed_description: A platform for quantitative metagenomics profiling that performs species-level taxonomic profiling, functional analysis, and strain-level population structure inference.

tools.name: plinkQC
tools.one_line_profile: R package for quality control of PLINK genetic datasets
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to perform comprehensive quality control on genotype data in PLINK format, including individual and marker filtering.

tools.name: libplinkio
tools.one_line_profile: C and Python library for reading PLINK genotype files
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight library for reading and parsing PLINK binary genotype files (BED/BIM/FAM), supporting both C and Python applications.

tools.name: Copenhagen
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of scripts for NGS and population genetics analysis
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing various scripts and tools for the analysis of genotyping and next-generation sequencing data, focusing on medical and population genetics.

tools.name: ngsPopGen
tools.one_line_profile: Population genetics analyses from NGS data
tools.detailed_description: A suite of tools for performing population genetics analyses directly from Next-Generation Sequencing data, accounting for genotype uncertainty.

tools.name: ngsTools
tools.one_line_profile: Programs to analyse NGS data for population genetics purposes
tools.detailed_description: A collection of programs for population genetics analysis of NGS data, including estimation of genetic diversity, differentiation, and other summary statistics from probabilistic genotypes.

tools.name: fineRADstructure
tools.one_line_profile: Population structure inference from RAD-seq data
tools.detailed_description: A software package for inferring fine-scale population structure from RAD-seq data using a haplotype-based approach.

tools.name: GeneticsMakie.jl
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance genetics data visualization using Makie.jl
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for creating high-performance, interactive visualizations of genetics and genomics data, such as GWAS plots and LD matrices.

tools.name: knockoffgwas
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-resolution localization of causal variants using knockoffs
tools.detailed_description: A tool implementing the knockoff filter for Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) to control the false discovery rate while accounting for population structure.

tools.name: nf-core/phaseimpute
tools.one_line_profile: Bioinformatics pipeline to phase and impute genetic data
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline developed by nf-core for phasing and imputing genomic data, ensuring reproducibility and scalability.

tools.name: StructuRly
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive plots for STRUCTURE and ADMIXTURE analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R package for creating comprehensive and interactive visualizations of population structure analysis results from software like STRUCTURE and ADMIXTURE.

tools.name: Sarge
tools.one_line_profile: Heuristic ancestral recombination graph inference
tools.detailed_description: A tool for inferring Ancestral Recombination Graphs (ARGs) using a heuristic, parsimony-based approach, suitable for analyzing population history.

tools.name: GRIMM
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Imputation and Matching for HLA Genotypes
tools.detailed_description: A tool for HLA genotype imputation and matching using graph-based methods, developed by the National Marrow Donor Program bioinformatics group.

tools.name: rBAPS
tools.one_line_profile: R implementation of Bayesian Analysis of Population Structure
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing the BAPS algorithm for Bayesian inference of population structure, allowing for efficient analysis of genetic data.

tools.name: SHAPEIT4
tools.one_line_profile: Segmented Haplotype Estimation and Imputation Tool v4
tools.detailed_description: A fast and accurate method for estimation of haplotypes (phasing) for SNP array and sequencing data, representing the 4th version of the SHAPEIT algorithm.

tools.name: SHAPEIT5
tools.one_line_profile: Segmented Haplotype Estimation and Imputation Tool v5
tools.detailed_description: The latest version of the SHAPEIT algorithm for haplotype estimation and imputation, optimized for large-scale sequencing datasets like the UK Biobank.

tools.name: MsPAC
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to phase reads, assemble haplotypes and detect SVs
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to phase sequencing reads, assemble haplotypes, and detect structural variants (SVs) using a multiple-sample approach.

tools.name: sparg
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial inference from ancestral recombination graphs
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing spatial inference using ancestral recombination graphs (ARGs), useful in population genetics to understand the geographic history of genetic lineages.

tools.name: pLink2
tools.one_line_profile: Software for analysis of chemically cross-linked proteins using mass spectrometry
tools.detailed_description: A search engine dedicated to the identification of cross-linked peptides and protein complexes from mass spectrometry data, supporting various cross-linkers.

tools.name: pLink3
tools.one_line_profile: Search engine for identification of cross-linked protein complexes
tools.detailed_description: The successor to pLink2, providing advanced search capabilities for identifying cross-linked protein complexes or proteomes from mass spectrometry data.

tools.name: opqua
tools.one_line_profile: Epidemiological modeling framework for pathogen population genetics
tools.detailed_description: An epidemiological modeling framework that integrates pathogen population genetics and evolution, allowing for the simulation of disease spread and genetic variation.

tools.name: polyploid-demography
tools.one_line_profile: Demographic inference in polyploids
tools.detailed_description: A tool for performing demographic inference specifically designed for polyploid organisms, addressing the complexities of multiple chromosome sets.

tools.name: harpy
tools.one_line_profile: Processing pipeline for linked-read data to phased haplotypes
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive pipeline to process linked-read data (e.g., 10x Genomics) from raw sequences to phased haplotypes, also supporting WGS data.

tools.name: talos
tools.one_line_profile: Rare disease variant reanalysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for the reanalysis of variants in rare disease genomics, aiding in the identification of pathogenic variants.

tools.name: Eagle
tools.one_line_profile: Haplotype phasing software
tools.detailed_description: A highly accurate and efficient software for phasing genotypes across large cohorts, widely used in population genetics and imputation pipelines.

tools.name: DATES
tools.one_line_profile: Method for dating admixture in ancient DNA specimens
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for estimating the time of admixture events in ancient DNA samples by analyzing the decay of ancestry covariance.

tools.name: MagicalRsq
tools.one_line_profile: Machine-learning-based genotype imputation quality calibration
tools.detailed_description: A tool that uses machine learning to calibrate and improve the quality metrics (Rsq) of genotype imputation results.

tools.name: fastStructure
tools.one_line_profile: Variational framework for inferring population structure
tools.detailed_description: An algorithm for inferring population structure from large SNP genotype data using a variational Bayesian framework, offering faster performance than traditional STRUCTURE methods.

tools.name: slimr
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for SLiM population genetics simulations
tools.detailed_description: An R package that allows users to write, run, and analyze SLiM population genetics forward simulations directly from the R environment.

tools.name: HaplotypeTools
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for identifying recombination and recombinant genotypes
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools designed to identify recombination events and recombinant genotypes within haplotype data.

tools.name: demon_model
tools.one_line_profile: Spatially explicit model of intra-tumour population genetics
tools.detailed_description: A deme-based, spatially explicit simulation model for studying the population genetics and evolution within tumors.

tools.name: pophelper
tools.one_line_profile: R package to analyse and visualise admixture proportions
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to process and visualize output from population structure analysis software like STRUCTURE, fastSTRUCTURE, and ADMIXTURE.

tools.name: pophelperShiny
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive web interface for pophelper
tools.detailed_description: A Shiny-based web application that provides an interactive graphical user interface for the pophelper R package.

tools.name: qtl2geno
tools.one_line_profile: R/qtl2 module for genotype treatment
tools.detailed_description: A component of the R/qtl2 software suite, focusing on genotype data processing, including imputation, probability calculation, and map estimation for QTL analysis.

tools.name: STITCH
tools.one_line_profile: Sequencing To Imputation Through Constructing Haplotypes
tools.detailed_description: A method for haplotype imputation and phasing from low-coverage sequencing data without requiring a reference panel.

tools.name: sapphire
tools.one_line_profile: Polishing of Phased Haplotypes Integrating Read Enhancements
tools.detailed_description: A tool for improving the accuracy of phased haplotypes by integrating information from sequencing reads (SAPPHIRE).

tools.name: mlinker
tools.one_line_profile: Haplotype phasing from long/linked read sequencing
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to determine haplotype phase using data from long-read or linked-read sequencing technologies.

tools.name: seirsplus
tools.one_line_profile: Extended SEIRS epidemic dynamics models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing extended SEIRS models for epidemic dynamics, supporting network-structured populations, testing, contact tracing, and interventions.

tools.name: starmie
tools.one_line_profile: Plotting and inference for population structure models
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing utilities for plotting and performing inference on population structure models, facilitating the analysis of genetic clustering results.

tools.name: InStruct
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian MCMC Global Population Structure Analysis Program
tools.detailed_description: A tool for inferring population structure and selfing rates from genotype data using a Bayesian MCMC approach.

tools.name: admixture-simulation
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of admixed individuals using Wright-Fisher forward model
tools.detailed_description: A utility for simulating admixed individuals from pure ancestry individuals, useful for validating admixture inference tools.

tools.name: RFMIX
tools.one_line_profile: Local Ancestry and Admixture Inference Tool
tools.detailed_description: A discriminative method for modeling local ancestry in admixed populations, widely used for phasing and ancestry inference.

tools.name: SCOPE
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable population structure inference
tools.detailed_description: A method for scalable population structure inference from genomic data, developed by Sriram Lab.

tools.name: liftOverPlink
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper for liftOver to convert PLINK genotype data
tools.detailed_description: A tool to convert PLINK binary genotype data between different genome reference builds using UCSC liftOver.

tools.name: admixturePipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for running ADMIXTURE analysis from VCF
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline that automates the process of running ADMIXTURE analysis starting from VCF files.

tools.name: admix
tools.one_line_profile: Admixture analysis tool for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for admixture analysis supporting raw data from DTC genetic testing services like 23andMe.

tools.name: popgen-stats
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts to calculate population genetics statistics
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts for calculating common population genetics statistics.

tools.name: MultiTypeTree
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST 2 package for structured population phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: A BEAST 2 package that provides support for multi-type trees, enabling phylogenetic inference on structured populations.

tools.name: MethPhaser
tools.one_line_profile: Methylation-based haplotype phasing of human genomes
tools.detailed_description: A tool for phasing human genomes using methylation data, leveraging the correlation between methylation patterns and haplotypes.

tools.name: cobraa
tools.one_line_profile: Coalescent based reconstruction of ancient admixture
tools.detailed_description: A hidden Markov model to infer ghost admixture using just a diploid sequence based on coalescent theory.

tools.name: msprime
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient coalescent simulation of genomic data
tools.detailed_description: A robust and efficient simulator of ancestry and genomic sequence data using population genetic models.

tools.name: tskit
tools.one_line_profile: Tree sequence toolkit for population genetics
tools.detailed_description: A library for succinct storage and processing of large-scale genetic genealogy and population genetic data.

tools.name: deep_ev_tracker
tools.one_line_profile: Data-driven Feature Tracking for Event Cameras
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning based feature tracker specifically designed for event cameras.

tools.name: rl_vo
tools.one_line_profile: Reinforcement Learning Meets Visual Odometry
tools.detailed_description: A reinforcement learning approach to visual odometry for robotics navigation.

tools.name: rpg_timelens
tools.one_line_profile: Event-based Video Frame Interpolation
tools.detailed_description: A method for video frame interpolation using event camera data.

tools.name: finemapr
tools.one_line_profile: R wrapper pipeline for genetic fine-mapping tools
tools.detailed_description: An R package that implements a workflow for fine-mapping of genetic variants, wrapping external tools such as FINEMAP, CAVIAR, PAINTOR, and GCTA-COJO to streamline the analysis process.

tools.name: ancestry
tools.one_line_profile: Admixture coefficient estimation from genotype data
tools.detailed_description: A program designed to estimate admixture coefficients for individuals using genotype or sequence data, useful in population genetics for inferring ancestry proportions.

tools.name: HapCUT
tools.one_line_profile: Haplotype phasing from DNA sequence reads
tools.detailed_description: A tool for assembling haplotypes from sequence reads, capable of handling data from various sequencing technologies to resolve phase information of variants.

tools.name: WhatsHap
tools.one_line_profile: Read-based phasing of genomic variants
tools.detailed_description: A software for phasing genomic variants using DNA sequencing reads, also known as haplotype assembly. It works with long reads (PacBio, Nanopore) and supports various phasing modes.

tools.name: admix-simu
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of admixture between multiple populations
tools.detailed_description: A program to simulate admixture events involving multiple ancestral populations, useful for testing population genetics models and inference tools.

tools.name: PSVCP
tools.one_line_profile: Pan-genome construction and variation calling pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed for constructing pan-genomes and calling population structure variations, facilitating the analysis of genetic diversity across populations.

tools.name: TrackVLA
tools.one_line_profile: Embodied visual tracking model for robotics
tools.detailed_description: A vision-language-action model implementation for embodied visual tracking in the wild, enabling robots to track objects based on visual and semantic cues.

tools.name: HapHiC
tools.one_line_profile: Allele-aware scaffolding tool using Hi-C data
tools.detailed_description: A fast, reference-independent scaffolding tool that uses Hi-C data to correct assembly errors and anchor contigs to chromosomes, with allele-aware capabilities for phasing.

tools.name: seqminer
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient query of genomic sequence data in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package for efficiently querying and retrieving data from VCF, BCF, and BGEN files, facilitating the handling of large-scale genomic datasets in R environments.

tools.name: HIBAG
tools.one_line_profile: HLA genotype imputation with attribute bagging
tools.detailed_description: An R package for imputing HLA genotypes using SNP data, employing an attribute bagging method to handle the high polymorphism of the HLA region.
